sen.j: 慈光寺家（じこうじけ）は宇多源氏の流れを汲む源氏堂上源氏。
sen.e: The Jikoji family is a member of Genji Tosho Genji (the Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), who is a descendant of Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan).
The Jikoji family is a member of Genji Tosho Genji (the Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), descendants of Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan).
The Jikoji family is a member of Genji Tosho Genji (Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), descendants of Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan) → Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan) 用語集に沿い修正

sen.j: 衛門府・五辻家の次男慈光寺仲清を祖とする。
sen.e: Its patriarch was Emonfu (member of the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) Nakakiyo JIKOJI, the second son of the Itsutsuji family.
Its patriarch was Emonfu (member of the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) Nakakiyo JIKOJI, the second son of the Itsutsuji family.
Its patriarch was Emonfu (member of the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) Nakakiyo JIKOJI, the second son of the Itsutsuji family.
The family status is hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge (court noble)).
The family status was hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge - court noble).
The family status was hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge - court noble).

sen.j: 中務省・慈光寺冬仲の代で堂上家に列せられた。
sen.e: The family was added to the line of toshoke (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank) during the generation of Minister of Central Affairs Fuyunaka JIKOJI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The family was added to the line of toshoke (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank) during the generation of Minister of Central Affairs Fuyunaka JIKOJI.
The family was added to the line of toshoke (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank) during the generation of Minister of Central Affairs Fuyunaka JIKOJI.

sen.j: 慈光寺澄中（1713年～1795年）が従二位・左馬寮に叙せられて以降、従二位・非参議が極官となる。
sen.e: After Suminaka JIKOJI (1713 - 1795) was appointed to Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Samaryo (Left Division of Bureau of Horses), the highest court positions appointed were Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Suminaka JIKOJI (1713 - 1795) was appointed to Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Samaryo (Left Division of Bureau of Horses), the highest court positions appointed were Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).

After Suminaka JIKOJI (1713 - 1795) was appointed to Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Samaryo (Left Division of Bureau of Horses), the highest court positions appointed were Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 30 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was thirty koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was thirty koku.
The family status after the Meiji period is that of a viscount.
The family status after the Meiji period was viscount.
The family status after the Meiji period was viscount.
